sections.text:
### Overview
We will define a minimum viable “Guidance” surface embedded inside Salesforce and HubSpot so sellers can consume Sales_Accelerator insights without leaving the CRM. The goal is a consistent, lightweight UI spec that engineering can implement via the native extension points in each CRM (Salesforce: Lightning App/Record Page components + Utility Bar; HubSpot: CRM extension/CRM card/sidebar where available). This doc will cover the UI layout at a wireframe level, supported objects (Accounts and Opportunities/Deals), and the exact content blocks and actions in scope for v1.

### Entry points & placement
For **Accounts**, guidance should be accessible from (1) a right-side panel or record-page card on the Account record, and (2) an optional persistent entry point (e.g., Salesforce Utility Bar / HubSpot sidebar) that deep-links to the currently viewed record. For **Opportunities/Deals**, guidance should appear on the Opportunity/Deal record with the same component location for consistency, with the default state showing the highest-priority item(s). In both CRMs, the entry point must be visible without page customization beyond adding the component once, and it must render in a compact mode suitable for common sidebar widths.

### Content blocks (v1 scope) & actions
The embedded surface will support three blocks, ordered by priority and collapsible: **Best Next Action** (single recommended action with rationale + due timeframe), **Risk Alerts** (list of detected risks with severity and short explanation), and **Fit/Positioning Snippets** (short talk tracks tailored to the account/opportunity context). Each block supports explicit copy actions: **Copy** (copies the text snippet to clipboard), **Copy w/ link** (copies text plus a deep link to the guidance item), and **Mark as done/dismiss** (per-item state stored server-side). Out of scope for v1: editing guidance, long-form playbooks, multi-step wizards, and any automated CRM field writes.

### Wireframe requirements & acceptance criteria
Wireframe-level requirements: header with “Guidance” title + record context (Account/Opportunity name), loading/empty/error states, last-updated timestamp, and a vertical list of blocks with consistent typography and truncation rules (e.g., 2–3 line preview with “View more” expansion). Acceptance criteria: (1) On Account and Opportunity/Deal records, the component loads and displays guidance within an agreed performance budget (e.g., initial render <2s on warm cache) and never navigates the user away from the CRM; (2) Each block renders only when data exists, otherwise shows a neutral empty-state message; (3) Copy actions place expected text on clipboard and provide a lightweight confirmation; (4) Dismiss/done persists across refresh and across CRMs for the same user; (5) Component behaves correctly in narrow widths and respects CRM theming; (6) Analytics events are emitted for view, expand, copy, dismiss/done to unblock measurement.
